content: Hi T-cargo folks. I am looking at rustc issue #82151 and I happened to notice that cargo’s behavior changed pretty recently

I suspect it is a change for the better, but I just wanted to check in and see if it was intentional, and also try to figure out if it means that I shouldn’t worry much about the rustc issue itself that drove me to look at this.

@pnkfelix Yea, there was a change from 3 days ago regarding dylibs. It was working inconsistently whether it was a single-package project or a workspace.

I'm not sure how that relates to that issue which seems to be about a month old?
hmm. Okay. Thanks @Eric Huss ! I’ll look into it more.

(i’m going to try to allocate time to look at this; the dialogue on #82151 makes it sounds like there may be implicit feature requests here for cargo, but I haven’t dug into it deeply enough yet to say that for certain.)
I'm confused on what they are trying to achieve there
